content.title: Bypass Surveillance
content.definition: Duplex every 3 months for first year, then every 6 months. Detect and correct stenosis before thrombosis.
content.statement: Bypass Surveillance is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Bypass Surveillance helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Bypass Surveillance include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Bypass Surveillance.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
